alert.note: Alert for Badlands Area; Bennett County Area; Haakon County Area; Mellette and Todd Counties; Tripp County (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 07 at 1:38PM MST until November 07 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THOUGH THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SOUTH CENTRAL SOUTH DAKOTA AND PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST SOUTH DAKOTA... .DISCUSSION...Southeast winds are gusting 40 to 50 mph in south central and portions of southwest South Dakota this afternoon, with RH as low as 20 percent. These critical fire weather conditions will continue through the afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 331, 332, 333, 334, AND 335... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 331 Haakon County Area, 332 Badlands Area, 333 Bennett County Area, 334 Mellette and Todd Counties and 335 Tripp County. * WINDS...Southeast 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Badlands Area; Bennett County Area; Haakon County Area; Mellette and Todd Counties; Tripp County
